meanings.sent1: She banalizes every story she tells by repeating it too often.
meanings.sent2: The constant repetition of the song banalized its once unique melody.
meanings.sent3: He banalizes his jokes by telling them at every opportunity.
meanings.sent4: The overuse of emojis can banalize the impact of a heartfelt message.
meanings.sent5: The artist feared that commercializing his work would banalize its true meaning.

meanings.definition: To render or become trite or commonplace.
meanings.sent1: The constant use of cliches banalizes his writing style.
meanings.sent2: The mass production of art can often banalize its original beauty.
meanings.sent3: Her attempts to sound sophisticated only serve to banalize her speech.
meanings.sent4: The endless stream of advertisements can banalize even the most unique products.
meanings.sent5: The routine of daily life can sometimes banalize even the most exciting events.
